title: Breast-shaped hill
description: Laid bare in many places around the world. May have given their name toManchester.

title: Eiffel Tower replicas and derivatives
description: Not as unique as you might have thought.

title: Folly
description: Buildings prized for their uselessness.

title: Gravity hill
description: A hill that gives the illusion of objects rollingupit.

title: List of cities claimed to be built on seven hills
description: Almost 100 different cities across all inhabited continents, trying to get the credibility ofhaving something in common with Rome.

title: List of micronations
description: Ever wanted to start your own country?

title: List of tautological place names
description: Place names that containtruismsand say what they are.

title: Phantom island
description: Like islands, but they don't exist.

title: Pizza farm
description: All the ingredients of pizza, grown in one convenient location!

title: Recursive islands and lakes
description: Islands in lakes in islands in lakes in islands...

title: Rocket garden
description: Landscaping and rocketry, together at last.

title: Spite house
description: Various houses built solely out of spite for their neighbors.

title: Valeriepieris circle
description: An imaginary circle that contains the majority of the world's population, popularized onReddit.

title: Abuja Airplane House
description: An aeroplane-themed villa in the capital of Nigeria.

title: Akon City
description: A2000s R&B singeris planning his very own city in his nativeSenegal, based around his very owncryptocurrencywhich he calls "Akoin".

title: Bir Tawil
description: One of the few places on Earth not claimed by any country. An American trekked there and claimed it in 2014 as the Kingdom of North Sudan so he could make his daughter a princess.

title: Blue Desert
description: Following theEgypt–Israel peace treaty, theUnited Nationsgave several tons of blue paint to a Belgian artist, so he could commemorate it by painting a line of boulders in theSinai Desertblue.

title: Boulders Beach
description: A beach on the Southern African coast, near an urban residential area, known for being home to a colony of several thousand penguins.

title: Congo Pedicle
description: What happens when a tyrannical king decides he wants to hunt game in a swamp.

title: Dallol (hydrothermal system)
description: A region surrounding a volcano in Ethiopia, known for its alien-looking bright colours, and populated by vast salt plains and extremely hot acidic sulfur-emitting hot springs, that according to some studies, are absent of even the smallest microbes. There is anow-abandoned townof the same name nearby, which formerly held the record of the hottest inhabited place on Earth.

title: Gaet'ale Pond
description: A small lake in Ethiopia that was created in 2005 after an earthquake. It's not bitter, it's justreally, reallysalty.

title: Giraffe Manor
description: A hotel in suburbanNairobiwhere you can eat alongside one of the world's most endangered giraffe subspecies.

title: Hoba Meteorite
description: The largest intact meteorite in the world.

title: Jacob's Ladder
description: It's allverydownhill from here.

title: Kalakuta Republic
description: A compound housingFela Kuti- a famous Nigerian musician - his family, band musicians and recording studio, which he declared independent and used to criticize theNigerian military junta of the 1970s. They responded by raiding it with over a thousand soldiers, setting it alight, and throwing Fela's mother out of the window.

title: Lake Nyos
description: A lake in northwesternCameroonthatreleased gas in 1986, killing 1,746 people. One of three known gassy lakes, the others beingLake MonounandLake Kivu.

title: Lake Retba
description: A lake inSenegalthat is naturally pink and is one of the saltiest lakes in the world.

title: Mauritania Railway
description: Mauritania's entire national rail network consists of a single line connecting the centre of the country's iron mining industry with the port city ofNouadhibou. Said line is also home to the world's longest and heaviest trains, filled withiron oreand as long as 3 kilometres (1.9 mi) in length.

title: Oklo
description: The former site of the world's onlynatural nuclear fission reactors.

title: Palácio de Ferro
description: A bright yellow iron building inLuandadating back to the colonial era, that is noted for the fact that there is no record of who or why it was built - although legend has it that it was designed byGustave Eiffel, architect of theEiffel Tower.

title: Peñón de Vélez de la Gomera
description: A rock on theMoroccancoast connected to the mainland by an 80-metre-wide (260 ft)tombolo; it is owned bySpain. In 2012,four Moroccan irredentists attempted to storm and take over the territory.

title: Republic of Benin (1967)
description: One of the shortest-lived states in history, it was independent for only seven hours (07:00 to 14:00 on 19 September 1967).

title: Socotra
description: A Yemeni island that is geographically part of Africa, and is known as "the most alien-looking place on Earth" due to its strange flora. This includes the"dragon blood tree"and atree which produces cucumbers.

title: La Tante DC10 Restaurant
description: A groundedMcDonnell Douglas DC-10passenger aircraft inAccrathat has been converted into a giant plane-shaped restaurant.

title: Tromelin Island
description: An island near Madagascar that is famous for being the site of a major humanitarian disaster in the 18th century.

title: The Owl House
description: Not theacclaimed animated LGBT fantasy cartoon that aired on Disney Channel; this is an outdoor museum that was created by a reclusive outsider artist who decorated her inherited house with over 300 glass and concrete sculptures of owls, camels, peacocks, pyramids, and other forms.

title: Umoja, Kenya
description: An entire women's-only village inKenyaestablished in response toviolence against womeninSamburutribal society.

title: Blood Falls
description: A naturally occurring plume of saltwater that is blood red thanks to its highiron oxidecontent.

title: Mawson Peak
description: The tallest mountain in theCommonwealth of Australiais not on the mainland, but on a barren, uninhabited island more than 3,800 kilometres (2,400 mi) away.

title: McMurdo Dry Valleys
description: An area of Antarctica that a) contains anextremely saline body of water, and b) has not experienced rainfall for over two million years.

title: Marie Byrd Land
description: The largest unclaimed territory in the world. Notable for being bigger thanMongolia, having one of Antarctica's biggest human bases, and being the setting ofThe Thing.

title: New Swabia
description: The Nazi territory in Antarctica.

title: Pole of Inaccessibility research station
description: A short-lived Soviet research station in Antarctica that is now completely covered by snow - save for a small bust ofVladimir Leninpeeking out the ground.

title: Villa Las Estrellas
description: One of only two civilian settlements in Antarctica.

title: 798 Art Zone
description: How an abandoned complex of military factory buildings became the heart of Beijing's modern art scene.

title: Aoshima, Ehime
description: An island where cats outnumber humans 36:1. Weirdly not the only cat island in Japan (see:Tashirojima).

title: Artsvashen
description: An Armenian town surrounded and controlled byAzerbaijan. One of a number of similar towns on this border; others includeYukhari Askipara,BarxudarlıandKarki.

title: Atar, Padang Ganting
description: An Indonesian village with a monument resembling aphotocopier.

title: Bust of Ferdinand Marcos
description: AMount Rushmorein the Philippines, right down to displacing its indigenous inhabitants. It was mercifully blown up by rebels in 2002.

title: Camp Bonifas
description: The bunkers on this golf course feature machine-guns and landmines.

title: Chao Mae Tuptim shrine
description: A shrine dedicated to penises inBangkok, built in the early 20th century by a Thai businessman, on the edge of his property.

title: Christmas Island
description: A small island and external territory of Australia close to Indonesia that is mainly known for having up to 100 million crabs migrate to spawn there every year.

title: Dahala Khagrabari
description: India inside Bangladesh inside India inside Bangladesh. Formerly the only third-orderenclavein the world.

title: Darvaza gas crater
description: A flaming, 70 m (230 ft) wide, 30 m (98 ft) deep crater in the middle of theKarakum Desert, on fire since 1971.

title: Dhekelia Power Station
description: A Cypriot power station that provides power to a British military base that surrounds it.

title: Diomede Islands
description: Two islands in the Bering Strait separated by 4 kilometres (2.5 mi) and21 hours' time difference.

title: Gangkhar Puensum
description: The tallest mountain nobody has ever summitted, as the Bhutanese government has prohibited mountaineering since 2003.

title: Gate Tower Building
description: A skyscraper in Japan that has a highway offramp passing through its fifth, sixth and seventh floors.

title: Hallstatt (China)
description: An ongoing replica construction of a town in Austria.

title: Haesindang Park
description: Also known as "Penis Park", this is a park on the Korean coast, known for being full of wooden statues of penises, apparently to do with local shamanic folklore.

title: Hanazono Room
description: An indoor swimming pool in Japan used as the site for many pornographic films.

title: Hằng Nga Guesthouse
description: Vietnam's most fantastical building?

title: High-Heel Wedding Church
description: A glass slipper that Prince Charming would struggle to find a fit for.

title: Immovable Ladder
description: A ladder against a window that can't be moved unless six separate religious groups agree to it.

title: Imsil Cheese Theme Park
description: I dunno, this place seems a little cheesy to me.

title: Jackson Hole, China
description: A planned resort town outside of Beijing that is based off asmall town in Wyoming.

title: Jatinga
description: TheBermuda Triangleof birds.

title: Jaxa (state)
description: A 17th-century microstate located on the Amur River between the Tsardom of Russia and Qing China, with a population mostly consisting of Polish and Ukrainians.

title: Jewish Autonomous Oblast
description: In the depths of EasternSiberiathere's a place with street names inYiddish, even though 99% of its population is not Jewish.

title: Kabul synagogue
description: The last synagogue inKabulwas inhabited by two men, who both ended up being imprisoned by theTalibanbecause they got annoyed by the two constantly complaining about each other, before later being converted by one of the men into a kebab restaurant.

title: Kai Tak Airport
description: A major international airport closed in 1998 where planesliterallyalmost crashed constantly into the city due to a right-hand turn over the city.

title: Karni Mata Temple
description: A marble temple famous for 25,000 reveredblack ratsthat live in the temple who are considered the ancestors ofCharans.

title: Khewra Salt Mine
description: One of the largest salt mines in the world, it was allegedly discovered byAlexander the Great's horses.

title: Kijong-dong
description: Two unique Korean villages, separated by theDMZand notable for their arms race of giant flagpoles. The North Korean village contains apropaganda-blasting loudspeaker andzero residentsto hear it. Meanwhile its Southern counterpart forbids residency except to families that have been there since before theWar, and grows "DMZ rice" that makes the farmers exceptionally wealthy.

title: Korea Central Zoo
description: A zoo with such wondrous animals as achimpanzeewith a smoking habit, aparrotthat sings the praises ofKim Il-sung, anddogs.

title: Kowloon Walled City
description: A former enclave in the city of Hong Kong, known for lawlessness and extremely cramped conditions before it was destroyed and turned into a park.

title: Li's field
description: A supposed forcefield that explains why tropical cyclones swerve away from Hong Kong.

title: Living root bridge
description: Double-decker suspension bridges formed of living plantaerial rootsofrubber fig treesbytree shapingcommon in the southern part of theNortheast Indianstate ofMeghalaya.

title: Love Land
description: An erotic-themed sculpture park onJejuisland in South Korea.

title: Maijishan Grottoes
description: A massive complex of hundreds of man-made caves, stairways and thousands of Buddhist sculptures carved into the side of a mountain in the fifth century, high above the surface.

title: Masuleh
description: A village built on the side of a mountain in such a way that most of the walkable space in the village is on the rooftops of the buildings of the layer below.

title: Missing Post Office
description: Where all the world's undeliverable post goes.

title: Modern Toilet Restaurant
description: Wait, that isn't the kind of bowl I want to eat out of...

title: Nahwa
description: One of only eight counter-enclaves (enclaves of enclaves).

title: Nakhchivan Autonomous Republic
description: A landlockedexclaveofAzerbaijan(it is surrounded by three different countries rather than only one, so it is not anenclave).

title: Nanjie
description: A settlement inHenanProvince that is often described as "China's lastMaoistvillage", maintaining a collectively-owned economy and public displays and statues of historicMarxist-Leninistleaders.

title: National Fisheries Development Board building
description: Another example of mimetic architecture, this time inHyderabad, in the form of a building shaped like a humongous fish.

title: North Sentinel Island
description: A small island in theBay of Bengal, known for being inhabited by a virtuallyuncontactedisolationist tribe who attack all outsiders who attempt to land on their island. The Indian government leaves them alone, outlawing all travel to the island - although that hasn't stopped some foolish travellers from trying.

title: National Route 339
description: A national highway with a staircase in the middle.

title: Neutrality Monument
description: A massive legged arch built in the capital of Turkmenistan by theeccentric former dictatorto commemorate the fact that Turkmenistan is officially neutral. Also used to feature a gold-plated statue of him on top that constantly rotated so that it always faced the sun.

title: Okinoshima (Fukuoka)
description: An entire island that is considered akamiin theShintoreligion, and is continuously inhabited by lone Shinto priests who spend ten-day shifts guarding the shrine on the island. Women are prohibited due to theirmenstruation, as blood is considered impure in Shinto.

title: Ōkunoshima
description: An island between the Japanese home islands ofHonshuandShikokuformerly home to a chemical weapons plant in WW2, now home to a huge population of feral but largely tame rabbits.

title: Om Banna
description: An Indian shrine dedicated to a supposedly-sentient motorbike.

title: Omsk Metro
description: A metro system with only one station and a total length of zero kilometres.

title: Peanut Hole
description: A delightfully named patch of ocean in theSea of Okhotskthat was totally surrounded byRussia'sEEZbut not inside it. Often the subject of foreignoverfishing. The dispute was resolved in 2014 and the hole no longer exists.

title: Porcelain Palace
description: China's largest and most lavish palace - that is dedicated to the humblepublic toilet.

title: Rednaxela Terrace
description: A street in Hong Kong, whose name was reportedly reversed due to a clerical error.

title: Robot Building
description: That's not a giant robot looming in Bangkok; it's just a bank's headquarters.

title: Roopkund
description: A small lake in the Himalayas known for mysteriously having hundreds of ancient human skeletons along its edges.

title: Ryugyong Hotel
description: Once, it would have been the world's tallest hotel – except it lacked windows, fittings, or fixtures for over twenty years.

title: Sansha
description: A disputed prefecture-level city inHainanconsisting of a collection ofatollsand reefs throughout theSouth China Sea.

title: Kingdom of Sedang
description: In the 1880s, a French adventurer created a kingdom in Vietnam.

title: Seikan Tunnel Tappi Shakō Line
description: The closed funicular that connects an underground train station inside theSeikan Tunnelwith a museum.

title: Shani Shingnapur
description: A holy Hindu village that doesn't have any doors.

title: Shingō, Aomori
description: A town in Japan that is (supposedly) home to the tomb ofJesus. The story behind the supposed tomb is even odder.

title: Snake Temple
description: A Chinese temple most notable for having living snakes within its compounds. It also has a snake breeding area.

title: Sokh District
description: An exclave ofUzbekistanenclaved withinKyrgyzstanwith a 99%Tajikpopulation.

title: Taiwan Province, People's Republic of China
description: The Communist Chinese government elects delegates to represent an island it has never owned or controlled.

title: Tashirojima
description: An island inJapannotable for being full of cats. Weirdly not the only cat island in Japan (see:Aoshima, Ehime).

title: Thames Town
description: An entire replica English-style town built as an upscale planned community near Shanghai. Mostly empty, but a popular destination for wedding photography.

title: The Line
description: Aplanned cityin Saudi Arabia that was originally planned to be a 110-mile long straight line and has been described by critics as "dystopian."

title: Thimmamma Marrimanu
description: A single tree with a canopy that covers 19,107 m2, and consequently is considered sacred among followers of several Indian religions.

title: Tomb of Suleyman Shah
description: One of the burial sites of the first Ottoman emperor's grandfather is part ofTurkeydespite being 27 kilometres (17 mi) south of the country's border withSyria.

title: Trunyan
description: A village in Bali where residents openly lay corpses on the ground and wait for them to decompose instead of cremating or burying them.

title: Tsu Station
description: Bykana, the tersest railway station in Japan, servingthe capital of an almost as terse prefecture. By stroke count, the tersest in the world. By transliteration, onlysecond-tersest.

title: Underground City (Beijing)
description: A massive complex of tunnels underneath Beijing, built in the Cold War as a nuclear bomb shelter, fitted with facilities such as schools, clinics, factories and even an ice rink.

title: Villaggio Mall
description: A Qatari shopping mall built to resemble an Italian town, with Venetian canals andgondolas. Also notorious for being the site of a deadly nursery fire in 2012.

title: Wang Saen Suk
description: A place in Thailand dedicated to materializedBuddist's hell scenes.

title: Wonderland Amusement Park
description: The largest abandoned amusement park in Asia.

title: X-Seed 4000
description: The tallest building ever designed, standing 4 kilometres (2.5 mi) tall and housing 500,000 to 1,000,000people on 800floors. It is, however, "never meant to be built".

title: Yongning Pagoda
description: A 6th-centurypagodathat was possibly the tallest structure in the world until it was destroyed by lightning 18 years after its completion.

title: Zhangye National Geopark
description: A national park known for its mountains with natural multicoloured stripes.

title: Zheltuga Republic
description: An illegal gold mining settlement that developed into a thriving unrecognised country, only surviving because the Chinese government was unaware that it existed.

title: Abode of Chaos
description: An artist buys an old scenic house in a rural town and transforms it into a replica warzone that serves as an open-air museum of radical avant-garde art, angering locals enough to sue him in France's supreme court.

title: Ängelholm UFO memorial
description: A memorial to a reputedUFOlanding in Sweden.

title: Argleton
description: A non-existent town inLancashire,Englandthat appeared onGoogle Maps.

title: Baarle-Hertog
description: Two municipalities, one of Belgium and one of the Netherlands, thatsurround each other twice and many times over. Some houses and shops are in both countries.

title: Barack Obama Plaza
description: Amotorway service areainCounty Tipperary, Ireland celebrating the work and Irish heritage ofU.S. PresidentBarack Obama.

title: Barcelona Supercomputing Center
description: A supercomputer in a medieval chapel.

title: Barentsburg
description: A completely Russian town, inhabited by Russians, with Russian buildings, supported financially by the Russian government, located in Norway.

title: Barra Airport
description: An airport that only operates when the tide allows.

title: Battersea Power Station tube station
description: A train station named after a non-train station.

title: Beans and Bacon mine
description: With such little ventilation, visitors may want to avoid any source of ignition. Nearby mines are not to be outdone and have the following names: Mule Spinner, Frogs Hole, Cackle Mackle, and Wanton Legs.

title: Berlin Brandenburg Airport
description: An airport in Berlin whose construction is finished but which is unfinished in other areas. Construction was finished in 2012; however, the opening date was repeatedly pushed back as the fire suppression system was installed incorrectly. It finally opened in October 2020.

title: Bielefeld conspiracy
description: TheBielefeld-Verschwörungtries to hide the horrible truth about a city inNorth Rhine-Westphalia,Germanythat doesn't exist ... well, maybe.

title: Brennender Berg
description: A German coal mine on fire since 1668.

title: The Broomway
description: Perhaps the most dangerous path in the world. Would you join the hundred others who died walking the invisible path?

title: Brusio spiral viaduct
description: The title says it all, really.

title: Bucket Lake
description: A lake that only exists thanks to the wanton misuse of a plastic bucket.

title: Bunkers in Albania
description: Enver Hoxhaloved them so much he decided to fill his country with over 173,000 of them.

title: Büsingen am Hochrhein
description: A German town that isfully containedwithin Switzerland.

title: Butt Hole Road
description: A tiny residential street in the UK that was so infamous for its name that it became a tourist attraction.

title: Buzludzha monument
description: A futurist monument built by theBulgarian Communist Partythat looks like a communist spaceship – especially on the inside.

title: Carpatho-Ukraine
description: The third-shortest-lived state in history (seeBenin Republic in Nigeria); it was independent for only 24 hours.

title: Cerne Abbas Giant
description: An indecent chalk man in the English countryside.

title: Clachan Bridge
description: Walk across the Atlantic in just 30 seconds!

title: Colletto Fava
description: A 1,500-metre (4,900 ft) hill with a 61-metre (200 ft) stuffed pinkbunnyon top.

title: Cologne sewerage system
description: Probably the only sewers with a Chandelier Hall that hosts music performances. Probably.

title: Couto Misto
description: Ade factoindependentmicrostateon the border between Spain and Portugal that existed until the 19th century.

title: Crinkley Bottom
description: An unsuccessful series of three theme parks built across England, devoted to agrotesque and horrifying BBC children's TV character from the 90s. One of them collapsed within four months of opening due to a massive and costly legal dispute with the local council over funding and liquor permits, while the abandoned site of another was demolished after it was used to host illegal raves.

title: The Crooked House
description: A pub along the Staffordshire/Black Country border which was at an angle due to ground subsidence as a result of local mining activity, causing bottles rolled along tables to appear to roll uphill. It was destroyed in suspicious circumstances in August 2023.

title: Crooked Forest
description: A grove of pine trees that are all bent in the same direction just as they emerge from the ground, before going straight back up again as normal. Nobody knows why this is the case.

title: Cube house
description: A group of unusually-shaped houses designed to maximize their space.

title: Dancing House
description: Also known as "Ginger and Fred" for its resemblance to a pair of dancers.

title: Dartmouth railway station
description: A train station that has been open since 1864 despite no trains ever stopping there.

title: Dry Bridge
description: After the river that this bridge spanned was dried up, it remained, connecting two pieces of the same field that don't have any physical barriers between them.

title: Dumb Woman's Lane
description: A lane in East Sussex with a humorous name.Spike Milliganused to live there, andPaul McCartneywrote a poem about it.

title: Ebenezer Place, Wick
description: The world's shortest street.

title: Eichener See
description: A lake in southern Germany that only occasionally contains water.

title: Eurobridges Spijkenisse
description: The generic bridges of the euro banknotes brought to reality.

title: Fallen Monument Park
description: ARussianpark best known for its toppled statues.

title: Father Pat Noise plaque
description: O'Connell Bridge bears a tribute to a priest who was as dearly remembered as he was completely fictional.

title: Ferdinand Cheval
description: A postman, who, for thirty-three years, collected stones while making his rounds and used them to build asurrealPalais Idéal("Ideal Palace") of astonishing proportions and intricate detail.

title: Ferdinandea Island
description: The island that disappeared. And rose again. And sank again. And rose again. And sank again.

title: Flannan Isles Lighthouse
description: Located on Eilean Mór, this lighthouse to the west of Scotland is the subject of an enduring mystery over the disappearance of its keepers in 1900.

title: Forest swastika
description: A giganticswastikamade oflarchtrees that went unnoticed for nearly sixty years.

title: Free State of Bottleneck
description: When occupation zones don'tquitemeet closely enough, you get a tiny slice of the Rhineland that acts as its own country.

title: Fugging, Upper Austria
description: A village in Austria that used to be called "Fucking", but changed its profane-sounding name after years of torment in the form of stolen road signs (some of which had to be enstoned in concrete) to something that still sounds kind of profane.

title: Galešnjak
description: An island off the coast of Croatia that is naturally shaped like aheart symbol.

title: Gammalsvenskby
description: A Swedish village, populated by Swedes, who speakan ancient Swedish dialect, in Ukraine.

title: Gants Hill tube station
description: A station on theLondon Undergrounddesigned to look like a station on theMoscow Metro.

title: Graun im Vinschgau
description: This village's most proud landmark is an underwater church tower, the last remnant of the old flooded village right next to it.

title: Great Tower Neuwerk
description: The oldest standing building "in" Hamburg is a lighthouse over 100 km away.

title: Greetings from Jerusalem Avenue
description: A giant artificial palm tree created to remind everyone of the name of the street it's on.

title: Gropecunt Lane
description: A street name found in English towns and cities during theMiddle Ages.

title: Grūtas Park
description: Alternatively known as Stalin World, this park answers the little-asked question of "what should we do with all these Soviet-era statues and monuments from our oppressive past?" Won its creator, mushroom magnate Viliumas Malinauskas, the 2001Ig Nobel Prize.

title: Gutsbezirk Reinhardswald
description: A "village" that covers 180 square kilometres of uninhabited forest, with only two inhabitants: the owners of a restaurant.

title: Hill of Crosses
description: This small hill in northern Lithuania is home to over 100,000 crosses and otherCatholicsymbols planted in the ground.

title: I Love You Will U Marry Me
description: A graffiti proposal that has long outlasted the relationship, and is now marked by neon lights.

title: Icelandic Phallological Museum
description: A museum inIcelandsolely devoted to the collection ofpenisspecimens and penis-related art.

title: JASON reactor
description: The only nuclear reactor in a 17th-century building.

title: Kielce Bus Station
description: A Polish bus station that was deliberately designed to look like a UFO.

title: Kőbánya cellar system
description: Budapesthas an expansive underground complex of beer and wine cellars that is so large it totals around 200,000 square metres (2,200,000 sq ft) in area.

title: Krzywy Domek
description: The most interesting house in Poland.

title: Kursdorf
description: A village that was abandoned after being gradually encircled after a nearby major airport, resulting in an average sound level of nearly 60 decibels. It earned the title of "the loudest village in Germany".

title: Lacus Curtius
description: A pit in the middle of the Roman Forum; even the Romans didn't know why it was there.

title: Lahn
description: A city so unpopular, not only did it only last 2 years, but its only local elections were won by the party that promised to wipe it off the map.

title: Lake Karachay
description: Formerly a lake, it had so much nuclear waste dumped into it that it's now completely dry and possibly themost polluted place on earth.

title: Leaning Tower of Suurhusen
description: Beating the world-famousLeaning Tower of Pisaby 1.22 degrees.

title: List of destroyed landmarks in Spain
description: Over 60 interesting buildings, including larger castles, royal palaces, leaning towers, city gates which were completely or partially demolished and no longer exist, with their respective articles and images.

title: Llandegley International Airport
description: When is an international airport not an international airport? When it's not an airport at all.

title: Llanfairpwllgwyngyll
description: Or Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch, if you want to get technical.

title: Lupanar
description: A brothel preserved underneath the ashes ofPompeii, complete with 2000-year-old lewd grafitti.

title: Magic Roundabout
description: Only in the United Kingdom would you find a largeroundaboutwith sixmini-roundabouts. (Not to be confused with the "Magic Roundabout"s inColchester,SwindonorHigh Wycombe– or, for that matter,this "Magic Roundabout".)

title: Manneken Pis
description: A statue inBrusselsdepicting a urinating child. And its female counterpart.

title: Märket
description: A lighthouse built on this island led to a redefinition of the border betweenSwedenandFinland.

title: Metro-2
description: A purported secret metro line in Moscow.

title: Monte Kaolino
description: Aski resortwithout snow.

title: Mount Athos
description: An autonomous polity in Greece home to 20 monasteries, notable for being the only political subdivision in the world in which women (as well as female animals) are prohibited from entering for any reason.

title: Municipalities of Liechtenstein
description: The blotchy, angular borders between these divisions seem almost arbitrarily strange. TheUAE'sare similarly weird.

title: Museum of Broken Relationships
description: Zagreb is home to this collection of things left behind by break-ups.

title: Neitokainen
description: This isn't just any pond in Finland, this is a pond in Finland that looks exactly like Finland!

title: Nelson's Pillar
description: Dublin used to have its own version ofNelson's Column, that ended up serving as a symbol of British imperialism up until the 1960s, when it was blown up by Irish republicans, leading to the creation of several celebratory folk songs.

title: Neutral Moresnet
description: A tinyEuropeanregion – approximately 1.4 square miles (3.6 km2) – that existed for a century asneutral territorybetweenGermanyandBelgium.

title: Newhaven Marine railway station
description: A railway station that was technically open between 2006 and 2020, despite (a) no passenger trains serving the station during that time, (b) an inability to buy tickets to the station and (c) the station itself being demolished in 2017.

title: New York-Dublin Portal
description: An art exhibit visually connecting the streets of the two cities that was temporarily shut down after multiple instances of flashing, profanities, and showcasing images of theSeptember 11 attacks.

title: Other World Kingdom

title: Kingman Reef

title: Murray Valley Highway

title: Nelson–Blenheim notional railway
description: A road that was officially considered to be a railway by the New Zealand Government for 22 years.

title: Ngerulmud

The entire population moved toNorfolk Islandfor three years in the 1850s and is currently at risk of going extinct due to the high number of emigrants. Also the site of a scandal where 13 Pitcairn Islands men, almost a third of the islands' population, were convicted in a sex abuse scandal, giving the islands the highest rate of sex offenders in the world.

title: Pink Lake

description: A freeway with houses, traffic lights, and a 60-kilometre-per-hour (37 mph) limit in some areas. What are VicRoads thinking?
